idx = torch.arange(0, ctx.input_numel).long()

body:
Yeah, one more function without cuda support :-/
One quick solution would be to change [this line](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/autograd/_functions/tensor.py#L821-L822) to something like (untested)
```python
idx = torch.arange(0, ctx.input_numel).long()
if input.data.is_cuda:
    with torch.cuda.device_of(input.data):
        idx = idx.cuda()
```
But ideally we should add cuda support for `arange`.
